UI.noInput: Please answer before viewing the solution

question: Thames is shopping for a new pair of jeans. He notices that one brand is priced at $49.99 and another is priced at $50.00. He immediately chooses the pair priced at $50.00 because he believes they are of better quality. Which pricing tactic was used to help Thames make his decision?

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: That’s not correct. Economy pricing is a tactic used to set prices much lower than that of competitors.
That’s not correct. Bundle pricing is a tactic that has a lower price for a bundle of items than when those items are purchased separately.
That’s not correct. Captive pricing is a tactic used when there is both a core and a captive product.
Odd-even pricing is a tactic used to illustrate value or quality to a customer through pricing.

detailedSolution: Odd-even pricing is a tactic used to illustrate value or quality to a customer through pricing.
